title: Textbook of Paediatric Emergency Medicine
role_in_edaitutor: Core paediatric emergency reference covering acute illness, trauma, procedures, and developmental considerations.

chapters.summary: Covers structured paediatric assessment including appearance, breathing, and circulation, supported by age-specific physiology.
Provides guidance for management of common paediatric respiratory presentations, including severity assessment and escalation.
Summarises evaluation and management of shock in children, highlighting unique physiological responses compared to adults.
Covers acute neurological presentations including seizures, trauma, and CNS infections in paediatric patients.
Provides ED-based frameworks for evaluating acute abdominal presentations in children.
Discusses trauma mechanisms, assessment, and management specific to paediatric physiology.
Describes common ED procedures in paediatric patients, including sedation and analgesia.
